subject: BIOLOGY
content:

what cellular structures?

content:
In humans, backflow of blood from ventricles into atria during
contraction is prevented primarily by what structures?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content: What are the names for positive and negative ions, respectively?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Arrange the following 4 substances in order of increasing pH:
orange juice; human gastric juice; blood; aqueous ammonia
answer: HUMAN GASTRIC JUICE; ORANGE JUICE; BLOOD; AQUEOUS AMMONIA

content: What is the scientific term for a change in velocity per unit time?

times velocity?

content:

are: 64, 16, 4

content:

an isosceles right triangle is 100 centimeters long, how long is the hypotenuse?

content:

the two most abundant gases in Earth’s atmosphere?

content:
What type of glacier flows outward from a center as opposed
to down a mountain valley?

subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
content:
One kilogram is nearly equivalent to how many pounds:
W) 454
X) 4.54
Y) 220
Z) 2.2

content:

highly flammable because of its low flash point:
W) glycerol
X) methanol
Y) carbon tetrachloride
Z) sulfuric acid

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
What is the most common term for the celestial phenomenon that
causes a comet's tail in our solar system to point away from the Sun?

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
Which of the following is the BEST description of our Sun:
W) a cool large star similar to Proxima Centauri
X) a small-sized star about 6 billion years old
Y) a mid-sized yellow dwarf star
Z) a large-sized red giant about 4.7 billion years old
answer: Y) A MID-SIZED YELLOW DWARF STAR

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Which of the following occurs in meiosis but NOT in mitosis:
W) spindle apparatus attaches to kinetochores
X) nuclear membrane is not visible
Y) crossing over
Z) chromosomes line up at central area of cell

content:
What is the anatomical term for the specific section of the small
intestine into which the pancreatic duct delivers its digestive enzymes?

content:

insufficient, what colorless, odorless and poisonous gas is produced?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:

many neutrons does this isotope contain?

content:
. The amplitude of a sound wave most closely relates to its:
W) frequency
X) wavelength
Y) loudness
Z) overtones

content:

violin’s note?

content:

the absolute value of x equals minus 15)

content:

than the number. What is the number?

content:
Giving your answer as north, south, east, or west, from what
general direction does the jet stream flow?

subject: EARTH SCIENCE

In which of the following locations would you typically
expect the average salinity of surface sea water to be the HIGHEST:
W) at the mouth of the Mississippi River
X) in the waters above the Arctic Circle
Y) in the Black Sea
Z) in the Dead Sea

content: In the mks system, what are the 3 fundamental units?

content:

square meters into square millimeters:

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
Which of the following is NOT true:
W) most of the meteorites that have been found have a high iron content
X) a bolometer is used to measure the energy output of the Sun
Y) the celestial coordinate analogous to latitude is called ascension
Z) sunlight reflecting off the Earth is called Earthshine
answer:
Y) THE CELESTIAL COORDINATE ANALOGOUS TO LATITUDE IS CALLED
ASCENSION

subject: ASTRONOMY
content:
Which of the following BEST describes the zenith:
W) the point in the sky that is at 180 degrees of inclination to the horizon
X) 90 degrees opposite to the nadir
Y) the opposite position on the ecliptic to an observer
Z) the point on the celestial sphere directly overhead of an observer
answer:
Z) THE POINT ON THE CELESTIAL SPHERE DIRECTLY OVERHEAD OF AN
OBSERVER

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
Which of the following MOST closely represents the location of
the temporal bone in humans:
W) above the eye
X) cheek or lateral border of the eye
Y) back of skull
Z) top of skull
answer: X) CHEEK OR LATERAL BORDER OF THE EYE

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
What is the common name for the joint that is formed by the
articulation of the tibia, the fibula, and the femur?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content: How many unpaired electrons are in a neutral bromine atom?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
Which of the following is the term used to describe the
resistance to flow of a liquid:
W) viscosity
X) surface tension
Y) maleability
Z) vapor pressure

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Which of the following is the most common term for the general
type of wave that results from the vibration of a physical medium:
W) mechanical
X) electromagnetic
Y) perfect
Z) pulsed

subject: PHYSICS
content:
Which of the following is LEAST accurate:
W) alpha particles are the same as helium nuclei
X) polarization of light supports the particle behavior of light
Y) a photon is a particle of light
Z) light slows down when it moves from a vacuum into glass
answer:
X) POLARIZATION OF LIGHT SUPPORTS THE PARTICLE BEHAVIOR OF
LIGHT

plains that are areas of the Moon that appear dark as viewed from Earth?

content:

single one of its planetary days?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
What is typically the largest organelle of a mature plant cell and can
comprise up to 80% of the cell’s volume?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
What eukaryotic cell organelle primarily functions to modify, sort,
and package products for exocytosis?
answer: GOLGI (ACCEPT: GOLGI APPARATUS, COMPLEX or STACK)

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
What scientific principle BEST describes why fresh pickles
soaked in brine shrivel up after a period of time?

subject: CHEMISTRY
content:
If two solutions that are separated by a semipermeable
membrane have the same osmotic pressure, they are said to be:
W) isotonic
X) hypotonic
Y) hypertonic
Z) hyperosmotic

subject: PHYSICS
content:
A circuit with 2 different resistors wired in series will have a total
resistance that is:
W) equal to the sum of the two resistances
X) less than either resistance
Y) equal to that of the greater resistance
Z) equal to that of the lesser resistance
answer: W) EQUAL TO THE SUM OF THE TWO RESISTANCES

content: What is the most common isotope of carbon?

subject: BIOLOGY
content: How many walking legs are found in arachnids?

subject: BIOLOGY
content:
What is the MOST common term for the general type of
nourishment characteristic of mushrooms where the organism derives its nutrients by absorbing the
biological products of another organism?
answer: SAPROPHYTIC (ACCEPT: SAPROBE or SAPROPHAGE or SAPROPHYTE)
